page.title: 03Harvington Church.
page.content: Harvington has one church and one chapel.Norton also has a church. Harvington church has six bells and they work automatically by use of a clock.The church is not all the same age .It was built in the twelfth century and enlarged in the fourteenth.In eighteen hundred and fifty-five a brooch spire made of copper was added. The copper has eroded and the spire is now coloured green .The spire is ninety nine feet high with the cockerel.The church used to own the whole village.It now owns a farm called Green Street.The cottage where the church candle maker used to live is being repaired because the front timbers are rotten.This cottage is close to the church.There is a witches'door on the north side of the church. I was christened in the village church.
